title: Verify the Report totals for scanned tickets in the Scan Media Summary report
custom_preconds:
Verify the Report totals for scanned tickets in the Scan Media Summary report
 
 
 
Prerequisite:
1. Identify an active event from TC#1. TCs above would have completed all the different transactions and scan codes available for this event. 
2. There should be both scanned and unscanned tickets available for this event.
 
Steps to verify:
1. Launch TDC Application
2. Login as a regular user
3. Navigate to Reports
4. Select the Scan Media Summary report
5. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
6. Generate the report.
7. Export as PDF

Expected Result: The counts displayed in Scanned Total, Unscanned Total and Total should match with the transactions done.

title: Verify the column order of the Scan Media Types displayed in the Scan Media Summary report
custom_preconds:
Verify the column order of the Scan Media Types displayed in the Scan Media Summary report
 
 
 
Prerequisite:
1. Identify an active event from TC#1. TCs above would have completed all the different transactions and scan codes available for this event.

Steps to verify:
1. Launch TDC Application
2. Login as a regular user
3. Open Scan Media Summary Report
4. Provide the supplier and event as the input parameters.
5. Generate the report
6. Verify the report

Expected Result: The columns should be displayed in the below order -

Ticket Stock
Tickets@Home
Passbook
MyTickets Mobile
Will Call API Entry
Externally Printed
Tickets@Phone
Custom Partner


Unspecified & Unrecognized

title: Verify that the scan media types C1, C2, C3, C4 and C5  are summed and combined into a single column labeled Custom Partners in the Scan media Summary report
custom_preconds:
Verify that the scan media types C1, C2, C3, C4 and C5  are summed and combined into a single column labeled Custom Partners in the Scan media Summary report 
 
 
Prerequisite:
1. Login to PVNG application as API user - apiuserj/Password12t
2. Navigate to Org admin >> Verify five new Custom Scan Media Types is available in Org admin page
3. Complete a sales transaction [>=5 tickets] for the event created in TC#1.
4. Print the tickets and note down the barcodes.

Steps to verify:
1. Launch Advanced Rest Client 
2. Open 'V2 Create Scan Actions API' in Advanced Rest Client
3. Provide Scan Media Type as 'C1'
4. Provide the barcode noted in prerequiste#4.
5. Run the API.
6. Go to TDC Application.
7. Select the Scan Media Summary report
8. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
9. Generate the report.
10. Export as PDF
Expected Result: 'Custom Partners' Scan Media Type column should display in the Scan Media Summary Report.

11. Repeat Steps# 2 - 10 for the scan media types C2, C3, C4, C5.
Expected Result: All the 5 tickets should be added to the 'Custom Partners' of the Scan Media Summary report

Prerequisite:
1. Login to PVNG application as API user - 
apiuserj/Password12t
2. Navigate to Org admin >> Verify five new 
Custom Scan Media Types is available in Org 
admin page
3. Complete a sales transaction [>=5 tickets] 
for the event created in TC#1.
4. Print the tickets and note down the 
barcodes.

title: Verify that Unspecified & Unrecognized Scan Media Type column is displayed in the Scan Media Summary Report
custom_preconds:
Verify that Unspecified & Unrecognized Scan Media Type column is displayed in the Scan Media Summary Report
 
 
 
Prerequisite:
1. Open the active event created in TC#1.
2. Set Ticket Print Status of the event as 'Now'
 
Steps to verify:
1. Launch PVNG application
2. Login as API User - apiuserj/Password12t
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales
4. Select the Event created in Prerequisite#1 and complete a sale transaction
5. Print the tickets
6. Open the order and note down the barcodes of the tickets.
7. Launch TDC Application
8. Login as a regular user
9. Navigate to Reports
10. Select the Scan Media Summary report
11. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
12. Generate the report.
13. Export as PDF
Expected Result: Report should be generated successfully.
14. Open 'V2 Create Scan Actions API' in Advanced Rest Client
15. Provide Scan Media Type as 'US'
16. Provide the barcode noted in step#6.
17. Run the API.
18. Go to TDC Application.
19. Select the Scan Media Summary report
20. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
21. Generate the report.
22. Export as PDF
 
Expected Result: 'Unspecified & Unrecognized' Scan Media Type column should display in the Scan Media Summary Report

custom_preconds:
Verify that Passbook Scan Media Type column is displayed in the Scan Media Summary Report
 
 
 
Prerequisite:

21. Generate the report.
22. Export as PDF
 
Expected Result: 'Passbook' Scan Media Type column should display in the Scan Media Summary Report

custom_preconds:
Verify that Tickets@Home Scan Media Type column is displayed in the Scan Media Summary Report
 
 
 
Prerequisite:
1. Open the active event created in TC#1.
2. Set Ticket Print Status of the event as 'Now'
 
Steps to verify:
1. Launch PVNG application
2. Login as API User - apiuserj/Password12t
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales
4. Select the Event created in Prerequisite#1 and complete a sale transaction
5. Print the tickets
6. Open the order and note down the barcodes of the tickets.
7. Launch TDC Application
8. Login as a regular user
9. Navigate to Reports
10. Select the Scan Media Summary report
11. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
12. Generate the report.
13. Export as PDF
Expected Result: Report should be generated successfully.
14. Open 'V2 Create Scan Actions API' in Advanced Rest Client
15. Provide Scan Media Type as 'TH'
16. Provide the barcode noted in step#6.
17. Run the API.
18. Go to TDC Application.
19. Select the Scan Media Summary report
20. In the Input control pop-up, select the Supplier and Event.
21. Generate the report.
22. Export as PDF

Expected Result: Tickets@Home Scan Media Type column should display in the Scan Media Summary Report
